greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of steps needed to reach a prime when the following map is repeatedly applied to n: if n is even then 2n + #(n) + 1, otherwise 2n - #(n) - 1, where #(n) is the number of digits of n; or -1 is no prime is ever reached.
mathematica: pa[n_] := If[EvenQ[n], 2*n + IntegerLength[n] + 1, 2*n - IntegerLength[n] - 1]; Table[c = 0; If[PrimeQ[n], n = pa[n]; c = 1]; While[! PrimeQ[n] && c < 1000, n = pa[n]; c += 1]; If[c == 1000, c = -1]; c, {n, 2, 92}] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jul 09 2013 *)
program: 40 if odd(H)=1 then goto 90 else goto 50
results.author: _Felice Russo_, Sep 02 2002
